You are given a square board of size $n x n$ where $n$ is an odd number. Each cell on the board contains an integer. You can perform the following operation any number of times:

* Choose a sub-board of size $x x$ (where $x$ is any positive integer less than or equal to $n$).
* Multiply all the numbers in the chosen sub-board by -1.

What is the maximum sum of all the numbers on the board that you can achieve using these operations?

You are given a square grid of numbers. You can repeatedly select a square subgrid within the larger grid and multiply all the numbers in that subgrid by -1. What is the largest possible sum of all the numbers in the grid you can achieve?
